greeting: Greetings from The On-Line Encyclopedia of Integer Sequences! http://oeis.org/

results.name: Greatest common divisor of product p and product (p+2), where p ranges over distinct prime divisors of n; a(n) = gcd(A007947(n), A166590(A007947(n))).
link: Antti Karttunen, Table of n, a(n) for n = 1..15015
Antti Karttunen, Data supplement: n, a(n) computed for n = 1..100000
mathematica: f[n_] := If[n == 1, 1, Times @@ Power @@@ ({#[[1]] + 2, #[[2]]} & /@ FactorInteger[n])]; rad[n_] := Times @@ (First@# & /@ FactorInteger@n); a[n_] := GCD[rad[n], f[rad[n]]]; Array[a, 120] (* _Amiram Eldar_, Dec 16 2018 *)
program: A166590(n) = { my(f = factor(n)); for(i=1, #f~, f[i, 1] += 2); factorback(f); };
results.author: _Antti Karttunen_, Dec 16 2018
